alfe15_glass.description: Al plus 1/2 Fe from Oxalate times 15.625 plus weighted average of glass minerals in the .02 to 2 mm particle size fraction, based on particle size distribution percentages.

cosi_vcos.description: Total sand plus coarse silt is the soil separate with 0.02 to 2.0 mm particle diameter. It is reported a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.  N prep.

clay_tot.description: Total clay is the soil separate with <0.002 mm particle diameter. Clay size carbonate is included. Total clay is reported as a weight percent of the <2 mm fraction.

total_silt.description: Total silt is the soil separate with 0.002 to 0.05 mm particle size. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

coarse_silt.description: Coarse silt is the soil separate with 0.02 to 0.05 mm particle size. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

total_sand.description: Total sand is the soil separate with 0.05 to 2.0 mm particle diameter. It is reported a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. S prep

p_res1_24.description: Anion Exchange Resin Capacity is calculated by adding the reading at 1 hour and the reading at 24 hours.

al_fe_ox.description: The extractable aluminum is added to half of the amount of extractable iron in an ammonium oxalate solution.

vf_sand.description: Very fine sand is the soil separate with 0.05 to 0.10 mm particle diameter. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. Organic matter and soluble salts not removed.

vc_sand.description: Very coarse sand is the soil separate with 1.0 to 2.0 mm particle diameter. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. Organic matter and soluble salts not removed.

m_sand.description: Medium sand is the soil separate with 0.25 to 0.50 mm particle diameter. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. Organic matter and soluble salts not removed.

f_sand.description: Fine sand is the soil separate with 0.10 to 0.25 mm diameter particles. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. Organic matter and soluble salts not removed.

c_sand.description: Coarse sand is the soil separate with 0.5 to 1.0 mm particle diameter. It is reported a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. Organic matter and soluble salts not removed.

total_clay.description: Total clay is the soil separate with <0.002 mm particle diameter. Clay size carbonate is included. Total clay is reported as a weight percent of the <2 mm fraction. Organic matter and soluble salts not removed.

te_salt_si.description: The total estimated salt content of a sample is calculated from the electrical conductivity. It is reported as gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

sar_si.description: The sodium absorption ratio is calculated by NA_SATX/sqrt((CA_SATX+MG_SATX)/2). It is approximately equal to the exchangeable sodium percentage.

na_exch.description: This is the exchangeable sodium percentage (ESP), reported on a <2 mm base. If salts are present, ESP has been corrected for the water soluble Na.

na_exch_sat_cec.description: This is the exchangeable sodium percentage (ESP), reported on a <2 mm base. If salts are present, ESP has been corrected for the water soluble Na.

sand_tot_psa.description: Total sand is the soil separate with 0.05 to 2.0 mm particle diameter. It is reported a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. S prep

fine_silt.description: Fine silt is the soil separate with 0.002 to 0.005 mm particle diameter. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

tex_psda.description: The laboratory determined texture of the <2 mm fraction is calculated from particle size separate data.

c_n_ra.description: The carbon to nitrogen ratio is calculated by C_TOT_NCS/N_TOT_NCS. It provides information related to soil fertility and the state of organic matter decomposition. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

ecec_cly_cec.description: The ECEC / total clay ratio is calculated by ECEC_CEC/CLAY_TOT. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

al_sat.description: Aluminum saturation is calculated by (AL_KCL/(Sum of bases))*100. It provides some inference of potential Al toxicity problems, although many other factors influence Al toxicity.

al_sat_cec.description: Aluminum saturation is calculated by (AL_KCL/(Sum of bases))*100. It provides some inference of potential Al toxicity problems, although many other factors influence Al toxicity.

base_al.description: The effective cation exchange capacity is calculated by BASE_SUM+AL_KCL. It is not calculated if soluble salts are present. It is reported as meq per 100 grams on a <2 mm base.

ecec_cec.description: The effective cation exchange capacity is calculated by BASE_SUM+AL_KCL. It is not calculated if soluble salts are present. It is reported as meq per 100 grams on a <2 mm base.

si8plusfe2_ox.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable silica times 8 plus the amount of ammonium oxalate extractable iron times 2. It is reported a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. M prep.

fetimes2_ox.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable iron times 2. It is reported a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. G prep.

sitimes8_ox.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable silica times 8. It is reported a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. G prep.

alfe60_glass.description: Al plus 1/2 Fe from Oxalate times 60.0 plus weighted average of glass minerals in the .02 to 2 mm particle size fraction, based on particle size distribution percentages.

cec_sum.description: This is the calculated CEC at pH 8.2. It is calculated by (BASE_SUM+ACID_TEA). It is reported as meq per 100 grams sample on a <2 mm base.

bsesat.description: NH4OAC base saturation (pH 7.0) is calculated by (BASE_SUM/CEC_NH4)*100.

bsesat_cec.description: NH4OAC base saturation (pH 7.0) is calculated by (BASE_SUM/CEC_NH4)*100.

w_cly.description: H2O and Ultrasonic probe dispersible clay, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent of <0.002 mm particles dispersed without organic matter and salt removal, and without chemical dispersion. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

cec8_cly_cec.description: The CEC-8.2 / total clay ratio is calculated by CEC_SUM/CLAY_TOT. It factors pH dependent charge into the inferences from CEC7_CLY. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

tot_gr.description: The total number of grains counted in the given size fraction.

k2o_tot.description: Total K oxide is calculated from the potassium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

al2o3_tot.description: Total Al oxide is calculated from the aluminum measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as  percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

fe2o3_tot.description: Total Fe oxide is calculated from the iron measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

db_15b.description: Bulk density, <2 mm fraction, 15 bar is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume being measured after equilibration at 15 bars water tension. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

cffvfsa.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 0.05-0.10 mm diameter (very fine sand), reported on a clay free <2 mm base.

wrd_ws13.description: WRD-whole soil 1/3 bar to 15 bar is the volume of water released when the soil is dried from 1/3 bar to 15 bars water tension. It is reported as centimeters of water per centimeter depth of soil, but the value is constant for other units.

wrd_l2.description: The water retention difference, <2 mm is the volume fraction of water released between 1/3 and 15 bar tensions, reported as inches of water per inch of soil, on a <2 mm base.

vft205.description: Particles with 0.05 to 2.0 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vf25075.description: Particles with 75 to 250 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vf205.description: Particles with 5 to 20 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vf250u.description: Particles with >250 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vf7520.description: Particles with 20 to 75 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vf752.description: Particles with 2 to 75 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

proj_subsidence.description: Particles with 2 to 75 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vf52.description: Particles with 2 to 5 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vft05002.description: Particles with 0.002 to 0.05 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

w15cly.description: The ratio of 15 bar H2O percent / clay percent is calculated by (W15AD or W15FM)/CLAY_TOT, reported as grams per gram, on a <2 mm base. It provides inferences about clay mineralogy and the effectiveness of dispersion in the particle size analysis.

w_silt_tot.description: H2O dispersible silt, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent 0.002 to 0.05 mm diameter particles separated without chemical dispersants or organic matter and salt removal. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w_cly_f.description: H2O dispersible fine clay, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent of <0.0002 mm diameter particles dispersed without chemical dispersants or organic matter and salt removal. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w_clyco3.description: H2O dispersible CO3 clay, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent of <0.002 mm particle diameter carbonates dispersed without chemical dispersants, organic matter and clay removal. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

bsecat_cec.description: Base saturation by sum of cations (pH 8.2) is calculated by (BASE_SUM/CEC_SUM)*100.

bsecat.description: Base saturation by sum of cations (pH 8.2) is calculated by (BASE_SUM/CEC_SUM)*100.

base_sum_cec.description: The sum of NH4OAC extractable bases is calculated as (CA_NH4+MG_NH4+NA_NH4+K_NH4). It is reported as meq per 100 grams on a <2 mm base.

adod.description: Airdry/ovendry H2O ratio is the ratio of air dry gravimetric percent water over oven dry (105 degrees C) gravimetric percent water. If gypsum is present, this ratio is corrected for crystal water in the gypsum.

w2bl2.description: 2 bar water, <2mm sieved, airdry is the gravimetric percent water in <2 mm airdry sieved samples after equilibration at 2 bars water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w15l2.description: 15 bar water on air dry soil is the gravimetric water content of <2 mm air dry samples after equilibration at 15 bars water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base. The value is influenced by clay %, mineralogy, and organic carbon %.

w1bl2.description: 1 bar water, <2mm sieved, airdry is the gravimetric water content of <2 mm sieved air dry samples after equilibration at 1 bar water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w32l2.description: 1/3 bar water <2 mm sieved is the gravimetric percent water in sieved <2 mm samples after equilibration at 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w3cld.description: 1/3 bar water <2 mm sieved is the gravimetric percent water in sieved <2 mm samples after equilibration at 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

al_kcl.description: KCl extractable aluminum approximates the exchangeable Al, and is a measure of the active acidity present in soils with a 1:1 water pH less than 5.5. It relates to the immediate lime requirement and the CEC of the soil.

mn_dith.description: Dithionite citrate extractable manganese is considered easily reducible manganese. It is reported as gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base. Values >0.2% are rare.

fe_dith.description: Dithionite citrate extractable iron is considered a general measure of total pedogenic iron. It provides inferences on the amount of iron in various forms, P fixing potential, aggregate stability, and degree of weathering. Reported as grav % on <2mm.

al_dith.description: Dithionite citrate extractable aluminum is an indicator of the amount of aluminum substituted for iron in iron oxides. It does not necessarily represent total pedogenic Al.

si_ox.description: The amount of ammonium oxalate extractable silica relates to the amount of allophane and imogolite in andic materials. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

mn_ox.description: The ammonium oxalate extractable manganese is assumed to be the fraction held in noncrystalline compounds. It is reported as milligrams per kilogram on a <2 mm base.

fe_ox.description: Ammonium oxalate extractable iron is considered a measure of the noncrystalline Fe in soils. It provides some inferences of the amount of Fe in various forms. It is reported as gravimetric % on a <2mm base.

al_ox.description: Ammonium  oxalate extractable aluminum is an estimate of the total pedogenic Al, much of which may be in noncrystalline materials or complexed by organic matter. It is reported as gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

vfg2.description: Particles with >2 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vfl2.description: Particles with <2 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vftl002.description: Particles with <0.002 mm diameter are reported as a volume percent on a whole soil at 1/3 bar water tension base.

vr_13w.description: The void ratio at 1/3 bar, whole soil is the calculated ratio of pore volume to solids volume at 1/3 bar water tension, reported as a ratio on a whole soil base.

vr_13l2.description: The void ratio at 1/3 bar, <2 mm is the calculated ratio of pore volume to solids volume at 1/3 bar water tension, reported as a ratio on a <2 mm base.

silt_tot_psa.description: Total silt is the soil separate with 0.002 to 0.05 mm particle size. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

w_slt_c.description: H2O dispersible coarse silt, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent of 0.02 to 0.05 mm diameter particles separated without chemical dispersion, or organic matter and salt removal. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w_snd_tot.description: H2O dispersible sand, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent 0.05 to 2.0 mm diameter particles separated without chemical dispersants or organic matter and salt removal. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

cec7_cly.description: This ratio is calculated by CEC_NH4/Clay. It provides an index to clay activity, and allows inferences about clay mineralogy, the contribution of clay to the exchange capacity, and solution chemistry to be made.

cec7_cly_cec.description: This ratio is calculated by CEC_NH4/Clay. It provides an index to clay activity, and allows inferences about clay mineralogy, the contribution of clay to the exchange capacity, and solution chemistry to be made.

sdmcvc.description: CMS analyte. Medium + coarse + ver coarse sand is the soil separate with 0.25 to 2 mm particle diameter. It is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

zn_trelm.description: Total Zn is the zinc measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

p_trelm.description: Total P is the phosphorus measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

ni_trelm.description: Total Ni is the nickel measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

hg_trelm.description: Total Hg is the mercury measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

mn_trelm.description: Total Mn is the manganese measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported a      s percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

pb_trelm.description: Total Pb is the lead measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

cu_trelm.description: Total Cu is the copper measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

co_trelm.description: Total Co is the cobalt measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

cr_trelm.description: Total Cr is the chromium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

cd_trelm.description: Total Cd is the cadmium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

zr_mjelm.description: Total Zr is the zirconium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported a      s percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

ti_mjelm.description: Total Ti is the titanium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as       percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

na_mjelm.description: Total Na is the sodium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

si_mjelm.description: Total Si is the silica measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

k_mjelm.description: Total K is the potassium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as       percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

p_mjelm.description: Total P is the phosphorus measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

mn_mjelm.description: Total Mn is the manganese measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported a      s percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

mg_mjelm.description: Total Mg is the magnesium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported a      s percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

cec_nh4.description: CEC by NH4OAC is the cation exchange capacity of the sample, determined by 1N NH4OAC in a system highly buffered at pH 7.0. It is reported as meq per 100 grams sample, on a <2 mm base.

ca_nh4.description: NH4OAC extractable calcium is the fraction removed by pH 7.0 NH4OAC. It is assumed to represent the exchangeable Ca. It is reported as meq per 100 grams on a <2 mm base. It is not reported for samples containing carbonates or soluble salts.

na_nh4.description: The neutral salt extractable sodium is the fraction removed by 1.0N NH4Cl.

k_nh4.description: The neutral salt extractable potassium is the fraction removed by 1.0N NH4Cl.

mg_exbase.description: The neutral salt extractable magnesium is the fraction removed by 1.0N NH4Cl.

mg_nh4.description: The neutral salt extractable magnesium is the fraction removed by 1.0N NH4Cl.

ca_exbase.description: The neutral salt extractable calcium is the fraction removed by 1.0N NH4Cl.

mn_pyp.description: Sodium pyrophosphate extractable manganese is the fraction extracted by 0.1M sodium pyrophosphate. It was originally considered the portion associated with organic compounds, although subsequent evidence indicates other forms are also removed.

fe_pyp.description: Sodium pyrophosphate extractable iron is assumed to be the fraction associated with organic complexes. It is reported as gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

c_pyp.description: Sodium pyrophosphate extractable carbon was originally thought to correspond to carbon that bound Fe and Al in spodic materials. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

al_pyp.description: Sodium pyrophosphate extractable aluminum is the fraction extracted by 0.1M sodium pyrophosphate. It was originally considered the portion associated with organic compounds, although subsequent evidence indicates other forms are also removed.

mn_kcl.description: The KCl extractable manganese approximates the exchangeable or plant available fraction. It is reported as milligrams per kilogram on a <2 mm base.

co3_clay.description: Carbonate clay is the part of <0.002 mm diameter particles that are composed of carbonates. It is reported as a weight percent of the <2 mm fraction.

co3_cly.description: Carbonate clay is the part of <0.002 mm diameter particles that are composed of carbonates. It is reported as a weight percent of the <2 mm fraction.

clay_f.description: Fine clay is the <0.0002 mm particle diameter soil separate. It is reported as a weight percent of the <2mm fraction.

fine_clay.description: Fine clay is the <0.0002 mm particle diameter soil separate. It is reported as a weight percent of the <2mm fraction.

fe_mjelm.description: Total Fe is the iron measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as per      cent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

al_mjelm.description: Total Al is the aluminum measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as percent of the element and reported as  percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

ca_mjelm.description: Total Ca is the calcium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

p_mehlich3.description: The phosphorus extracted by the Mehlich III solution.

Melanic.description: Melanic index is an absorbance ratio for melanic Andisols.

n_tot_ncs.description: The total (organic+inorganic) nitrogen in a sample supplies inferences on the soil potential to supply nitrogen to plants, and is used to determine C_N_RA and nitrogen distribution in a profile. It is reported as gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.  Det

n_tot.description: The total (organic+inorganic) nitrogen in a sample supplies inferences on the soil potential to supply nitrogen to plants, and is used to determine C_N_RA and nitrogen distribution in a profile. It is reported as gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.  Det

n_no3.description: The nitrate nitrogen is the fraction in NO3 form. It is extracted by 1M KCl and represents the soluble NO3 that may be subject to leaching.

min_lt2.description: Mineral Content, Loss on Ignition (400 degrees C)(8F1). The mineral content of the <2mm fraction is the gravimetric percent of plant ash and mineral particles that remain after ignition. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

acid_tea.description: Extractable acidity, BaCl2-TEA at pH 8.2, is a measure of the amount of acid neutralized at a set pH. It is a measure of the potential acidity present, and does not distinguish between exchangeable and nonexchangeable components.

w_slt_f.description: H2O and Ultrasonic probe dispersible fine silt, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent 0.002 to 0.02 mm diameter particles separated without chemical dispersants or organic matter and salt removal. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w_snd_vf.description: H2O and Ultrasonic probe dispersible very fine sand, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent 0.05 to 0.10 mm diameter particles separated without chemical dispersants or organic matter and salt removal. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w_snd_vc.description: H2O and Ultrasonic probe dispersible very coarse sand, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent 1.0 to 2.0 mm diameter particles separated without chemical dispersants or organic matter and salt removal. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w_snd_m.description: H2O and Ultrasonic probe dispersible medium sand, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent 0.25 to 0.50 mm diameter particles separated without chemical dispersants or removal of organic matter and salts. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w_snd_f.description: H2O and Ultrasonic probe dispersible fine sand, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent of 0.10 to 0.25 mm diameter particles separated without the use of chemical dispersants or removal of organic matter and salts. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w_snd_c.description: H2O and Ultrasonic probe dispersible coarse sand, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent 1.0 to 2.0 mm diameter particles separated without chemical dispersants or the removal of organic matter and salts. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

ca_mg.description: CMS analyte. Calcium plus magnesium in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

hco3_co3.description: CMS analyte. Bicarbonate plus carbonate in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

w15bfm.description: CMS analyte. 15 bar water on field moist soil is the gravimetric water content of <2 mm field moist samples after equilibration at 15 bars water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base. The value is influenced by clay %, mineralogy, and organic carbon %.

ph10_cac.description: CMS analyte. The pH, 1:10 soil-CaCl2 is the pH of a sample measured in 0.01M CaCl2 at a 1:10 soil:solution ratio.

ph10_h2o.description: CMS analyte. The pH, 1:10 soil-water suspension is the pH of a sample measured in distilled water at a 1:10 soil:solution ratio.

cecnac.description: CMS analyte. CEC by NaOAC is the cation exchange capacity of the sample, determined by 1N NaOAC in a system highly buffered at pH 8.2. It is reported as meq per 100 grams sample, on a <2 mm base.

oc.description: CMS analyte. Organic carbon is a measure of all organic forms of carbon in the soil, including organic carbon within minerals.

org_c.description: CMS analyte. Organic carbon is a measure of all organic forms of carbon in the soil, including organic carbon within minerals.

limnic_type.description: Limnic material type based on soil color and %fiber rubbed

decomp_state.description: Decomposition State based on soil color and %fiber rubbed

eom_minlt2.description: EOM (based on Total C) plus Mineral Content

eom_tot_c.description: Estimated Organic Matter based on Total C

glass_content_wt_avg.description: Weighted average of glass minerals in the .02 to 2 mm particle size fraction, based on particle size distribution percentages.

glass_content_tot_vfs.description: Total percentage of glass minerals in the Very Fine Sand, 0.05 to 0.1 mm particle size fracton.

glass_content_tot_vcs.description: Total percentage of glass minerals in the Very Coarse Sand, 1 to 2 mm particle size fracton.

glass_content_tot_ms.description: Total percentage of glass minerals in the Medium Sand, 0.25 to 0.5 particle size fracton.

glass_content_tot_fs.description: Total percentage of glass minerals in the Fine Sand, 0.1 to 0.25 mm particle size fracton.

glass_content_tot_csi.description: Total percentage of glass minerals in the Coarse Silt, 0.02 to 0.05 mm particle size fracton.

glass_content_tot_cs.description: Total percentage of glass minerals in the Coarse Sand, 0.5 to 1 mm particle size fracton.

cecbacl.description: CMS analyte. CEC by BaCl2 is the cation exchange capacity of the sample, determined by 0.5N BaCL2 in a system highly buffered at pH 8.2. It is reported as meq per 100 grams sample, on a <2 mm base.

w2bl2fm.description: 2 bar water, <2mm sieved, field moist is the gravimetric percent water in <2 mm airdry sieved samples after equilibration at 2 bars water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

w1bl2fm.description: 1 bar water, <2mm sieved, field moist is the gravimetric water content of <2 mm sieved air dry samples after equilibration at 1 bar water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

resist_min_tot.description: Total sand is the soil separate with 0.05 to 2.0 mm particle diameter. It is reported a gravimetric percent on a <2 mm base.

w5bl2.description: 5 bar water, <2mm sieved, airdry is the gravimetric percent water in <2 mm airdry sieved samples after equilibration at 2 bars water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

sr_mjelm.description: Total Sr is the strontium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored as elemental percent and reported as       percent oxide on the base of the size fraction used.

tl_trelm.description: Total Tl is the thallium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

w_trelm.description: Total W is the tungsten measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

sn_trelm.description: Total Sn is the tin measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

v_trelm.description: Total V is the vanadium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

mo_trelm.description: Total Mo is the molybdenum measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

sr_trelm.description: Total Sr is the strontium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

se_trelm.description: Total Se is the selenium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

sb_trelm.description: Total Sb is the antimony measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

be_trelm.description: Total Be is the beryllium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

ba_trelm.description: Total Ba is the barium measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

as_trelm.description: Total As is the arsenic measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

pps32.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a 1.5 inch sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

le_315l2.description: Linear extensibility percent, <2 mm, 1/3 bar/15 bar is the percent change in a clod dimension as water content changes from 15 bar to 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported as percent length change on a <2 mm base.

le_315w.description: Linear extensibility percent, whole soil,1/3 bar/15 bar is the percent change in a clod dimension as water content changes from 15 bar to 1/3 bar tension. It is reported as percent length change on a whole soil base.

le_d3w.description: Linear extensibility percent, whole soil, 1/3 bar/OD is the percent change in a clod dimension as water content changes from oven dry to 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported as percent length change on a whole soil base.

le_d3l2.description: Linear extensibility percent, <2mm, 1/3 bar/OD is the percent dimensional change of a clod as water content changes from oven dry to 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported as percent length change on a<2 mm base.

g_ufrmty.description: The coefficient of uniformity is a descriptive parameter calculated from the cumulative grain size distribution curve (gradation curve). It is used in the Unified Soil Classification System to evaluate grading characteristics of coarse materials.

g_crvtur.description: The coefficient of curvature is a descriptive parameter calculated from the cumulative grain size distribution curve (gradation curve). It is used in the Unified Soil Classification System to evaluate grading characteristics of coarse materials.

cc60p.description: The particle diameter (mm) at which 60% (by weight) of the particles in the <3 inch base sample are finer.

cc50p.description: The particle diameter (mm) at which 50% (by weight) of the particles in the <3 inch base sample are finer.

cc1.description: The cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles with <1.0 mm diameter, reported on a <3 inch base.

cc10p.description: The particle diameter (mm) at which 10% (by weight) of the particles in the <3 inch base sample are finer.

cc5.description: The cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles with <0.5 mm diameter, reported on a <3 inch base.

cc25.description: The cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles with <0.25 mm diameter, reported on a <3 inch base.

cc10.description: The cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles with <0.10 mm diameter, reported on a <3 inch base.

c_tot_ncs.description: Total carbon is a measure of all organic and inorganic nitrogen, including that found in organic minerals.

c_tot.description: Total carbon is a measure of all organic and inorganic nitrogen, including that found in organic minerals.

caco3.description: Carbonate in the < 2mm fraction is measured by CO2 evolution after acid treatment. It is reported as gravimetric percent CaCO3 on a <2 mm base, even though carbonates of Mg, Na, K, and Fe may be present and react with the acid.

fw_clod.description: The field water content of a bulk sample, <2mm is the gravimetric water content of a sample, as collected. It is reported as percent gravimetric water on a <2 mm base.

db_3rw.description: Bulk density, 1/3 bar rewet (organic soils) is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume being measured after samples have been equilibrated at 1/3 bar water tension, air dried, and re-equilibrated at 1/3 bar tension.

db_3brw.description: Bulk density, 1/3 bar rewet (organic soils) is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume being measured after samples have been equilibrated at 1/3 bar water tension, air dried, and re-equilibrated at 1/3 bar tension.

db_od.description: Bulk density, oven dry (105 C) is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume measured on oven dry (105 C) natural fabric (clods). It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

db_fmst.description: Bulk density, <2mm fraction, moist is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume measured at field (sampling) moisture on natural clods. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

ag_trelm.description: Total Ag is the silver measured after total dissolution of a size fraction of soil material. It is stored and reported as milligrams per kilogram on the base of the size fraction used.

RMScSi_d-1_S.description: Total resistant minerals is sum of the percentages of minerals resistant to erosion.

RMlt2_d-1_S.description: Total resistant minerals is sum of the percentages of minerals resistant to erosion.

RMms_d-1_S.description: Total resistant minerals is sum of the percentages of minerals resistant to erosion.

ph_naf.description: The pH, 1:50 soil-NaF suspension is the pH of a sample measured in 1.0N NaF at a 1:50 soil:solution ratio. If PH_NAF is > 9.4, andic materials are indicated.

pH_kcl.description: The pH, 1:1 soil-KCl suspension is the pH of a sample measured in 1.0N KCl at a 1:1 soil:solution ratio. If the pH in KCl < pH in water, Al+++ is indicated.

ph_kcl.description: The pH, 1:1 soil-KCl suspension is the pH of a sample measured in 1.0N KCl at a 1:1 soil:solution ratio. If the pH in KCl < pH in water, Al+++ is indicated.

fib_urb.description: Unrubbed fiber is an approximate measure of the fibric and hemic portions of the organic matter in a sample. It is reported as a volume percent of the sample.

fib_rb.description: Rubbed fiber is an approximate measure of the fibric portion of the organic matter in a sample. It is reported as a volume percent of the sample.

pyr_col.description: The Munsell color of the pyrophosphate extract of organic material provides information on the nature of the material. Light colors are associated with fibric materials, and darker colors with sapric materials.

clay_tot_est.description: The estimated total clay percentage is calculated based on the water retention 15 bar air-dry times 2.5.  The 15 bar air-dry value is adjusted if carbon is present (c_tot_ncs) which may be also adjusted if carbonates (caco3) are also present.

cc05.description: The cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles with <0.05 mm diameter, reported on a <3 inch base.

db_fmstw.description: Bulk density, whole soil, moist is the weight per unit volume of the whole soil, with volume measured at field (sampling) moisture in clods. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter, whole soil base.

s_tot_ncs.description: Total sulfur is a measure of all organic and inorganic sulfur, including that found in sulfide minerals.

lep_cly.description: The LEP / total clay ratio is calculated by LEP/CLAY_TOT. It is an indicator of clay mineralogy. It is reported, without units, on a <2 mm base.

fcly_cly.description: The fine clay / total clay ratio is calculated by CLAY_F/CLAY_TOT. It is an indicator of argillic horizon development. It is reported as grams per gram, on a <2 mm base.

wf_520.description: The gravimetric percentage of 5 to 20 mm diameter particles is reported on a <75 mm base.

wf_2075.description: The gravimetric percentage of 20 to 75 mm diameter particles is reported on a <75 mm base.

wf_25.description: The gravimetric percentage of 2 to 5 mm diameter particles is reported on a <75 mm base.

COLEws.description: The coefficient of linear extensibility is a derived value that denotes the fractional change in clod dimension from a dry to a moist state.

gypl20.description: Calcium sulfate as gypsum in the <20 mm fraction is reported as a gravimetric percent on a <20 mm base.

caco3l20.description: Carbonate in the 2-20mm fraction is measured by CO2 evolution after acid treatment. It is reported as gravimetric percent CaCO3 on a 2-20 mm base, even though carbonates of Mg, Na, K, and Fe may be present and react with the acid.

wp25075.description: The gravimetric percentage of 75 to 250 mm diameter particles is reported on a whole soil base.

wf_275.description: The gravimetric percentage of 2 to 75 mm diameter particles is reported on a <75 mm base.

wp205.description: The gravimetric percentage of 5 to 20 mm diameter particles is reported on a whole soil base.

wp250u.description: The gravimetric percentage of >250 mm diameter particles is reported on a whole soil base.

wp7520.description: The gravimetric percentage of 20 to 75 mm diameter particles is reported on a whole soil base.

cf752.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 2.0-75 mm diameter, reported on a clay free whole soil base.

cf202.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 2.0-20 mm diameter, reported on a clay free whole soil base.

wp752.description: The gravimetric percentage of 2 to 75 mm diameter particles is reported on a whole soil base.

cffvcsa.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 1.0-2.0 mm diameter (very coarse sand), reported on a clay free <2 mm base.

cffcsa.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 0.5-1.0 mm diameter (coarse sand), reported on a clay free <2 mm base.

cffmsa.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 0.25-0.50 mm diameter (medium sand), reported on a clay free <2 mm base.

wf_0175.description: The gravimetric percentage of 0.1 to 75 mm diameter particles is reported on a <75 mm base. Silty families have <15%, loamy families >= 15%.

cfffsa.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 0.10-0.25 mm diameter (fine sand), reported on a clay free <2 mm base.

cf205.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 0.05-2.0 mm diameter, reported on a clay free whole soil base.

cffcsi.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 0.02-0.05 mm diameter (coarse silt), reported on a clay free <2 mm base.

cf05002.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 0.002-0.05 mm diameter, reported on a clay free whole soil base.

cfffsi.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with 0.002-0.02 mm diameter (fine silt), reported on a clay free <2 mm base.

wpg2.description: The weight fraction of particles with >2 mm diameter is reported as a gravimetric percent on a whole soil base.

cfg2.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with >2.0 mm diameter, reported on a clay free whole soil base.

wpl2.description: The weight fraction of particles with <2 mm diameter is reported as a gravimetric percent on a whole soil base.

wf_l2.description: The gravimetric percentage of <2 mm diameter particles is reported on a <75 mm base.

cfl002.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with <0.002 mm diameter (total clay), reported on a clay free whole soil base.

cffcly.description: The gravimetric percent of particles with <0.002 mm diameter (total clay), reported on a clay free <2 mm base.

wp52.description: The gravimetric percentage of 2 to 5 mm diameter particles is reported on a whole soil base.

db_satw.description: The bulk density of saturated whole soil is calculated from the bulk density and water content at 1/3 bar water tension, and the amount of water needed to saturate the 1/3 bar soil. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a whole soil base.

db_sat.description: The bulk density of saturated <2 mm fraction is calculated from the bulk density and water content at 1/3 bar water tension, and the amount of water needed to saturate the 1/3 bar soil. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

db_odw.description: Bulk density, whole soil, oven dry is the weight per unit volume of the whole soil, with volume measured on oven dry natural fabric (clods). It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a whole soil base.

db_13bw.description: Bulk density, whole soil, 1/3 bar is the weight per unit volume of the soil, with volume being measured after equilibration at 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a whole soil base.

db_13bm.description: The moist weight (weight of solids and water at 1/3 bar tension) per unit volume, reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

abgpi.description: Atterberg plasticity index is the calculation of the liquid limit minus the plastic limit. It is defined by the ASTM D 4318 test.

po_fil13.description: Filled pores at 1/3 bar tension is the volumetric percent of water filled pores at 1/3 bar water tension, reported on a whole soil base.

po_drn13.description: Drained pores at 1/3 bar tension is the volumetric percent of drained pores at 1/3 bar water tension, reported on a whole soil base. These are defined as noncapillary pores.

pps40.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a No. 40 (0.42 mm) sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

pps4.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a No. 4 (4.76 mm) sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

pps200.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a No. 200 (0.074 mm) sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

pps10.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a No. 10 (2.00 mm) sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

pps5m.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles with diameters <5 microns (0.005 mm), reported on a <3 inch base.

pps38.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a 3/8 inch sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

pps34.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a 3/4 inch sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

pps20m.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles with diameters <20 microns (0.02 mm), reported on a <3 inch base.

pps2m.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles with diameters <2 microns (0.002 mm), reported on a <3 inch base.

pps2.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a 2 inch sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

pps1.description: This is the cumulative gravimetric percentage of particles passing through a 1 inch sieve, reported on a <3 inch base.

pH_sp.description: The pH, saturated paste is the pH of the solution extracted from the saturated paste sample. It is used as an indicator of the irrigated pH of soils with soluble salts.

ph_cacl2.description: The pH, 1:2 soil-CaCl2 is the pH of a sample measured in 0.01M CaCl2 at a 1:2 soil:solution ratio.

pHcacl.description: The pH, 1:2 soil-CaCl2 is the pH of a sample measured in 0.01M CaCl2 at a 1:2 soil:solution ratio.

optd_ox.description: Ammonium oxalate optical density is a measure of the light blocking capacity of the extract. It relates to the amount of noncrystalline materials dissolved by the solution.

w10l2.description: 1/10 bar water, <2mm fraction is the gravimetric water content of air dry <2 mm samples, after equilibration at 1/10 bar water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base. In sands, this value approximates field capacity.

w6l2.description: 0.06 bar water, <2mm fraction is the gravimetric percent water held by <2 mm samples equilibrated at 0.06 bar water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

h2osatx.description: Water content of the saturation paste is the gravimetric percent water in a sample prior to collection of the saturation extract.

so4_satx.description: Sulfate in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

na_satx.description: Sodium in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

resist.description: Resistivity is the electrical resistance of a saturated soil paste in a standard resistance cup, reported as ohms per centimeter on the <2 mm fraction. It is a measure of the amount of soluble salts in the sample.

k_satx.description: Potassium in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

p_satx.description: PO4 in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

no2_satx.description: Nitrite in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

no3_satx.description: Nitrate in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

mg_satx.description: Magnesium in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

fl_satx.description: Fluoride in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

ec_satp.description: The electrical conductivity of the saturation extract is used to estimate the concentration of salts in a sample, and provides inferences on cation concentration in solution and osmotic pressure. It is reported as mmhos per centimeter.

cl_satx.description: Chloride in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

co3_satx.description: Carbonate in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

ca_satx.description: Calcium in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

br_satx.description: The bromide anion in the saturation extract.

hco3sx.description: Bicarbonate (HCO3) in the saturation extract is the fraction removed from a sample by saturating the sample with distilled H2O, then vacuum extracting the water. It is reported as meq per liter of extract.

oac_satx.description: The acetate anion in the saturation extract.

ec_12pre.description: The salt predict electrical conductivity is used to determine whether additional salt analyses are needed, and to estimate appropriate dilution ratios for additional tests. It is reported as mmhos per centimeter of a 1:2 soil:water mixture by weight.

w_clay.description: H2O dispersible clay, <2mm (by pipette) is the gravimetric percent of <0.002 mm particles dispersed without organic matter and salt removal, and without chemical dispersion. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

clay_tot_psa.description: Total clay is the soil separate with <0.002 mm particle diameter. Clay size carbonate is included. Total clay is reported as a weight percent of the <2 mm fraction.

p_olsn.description: The Olsen extractable phosphorus is used as an indicator of available phosphorus in calcareous soil materials (pH >6).

p_nz.description: The New Zealand phosphorus retention is the gravimetric percent phosphorus removed from a solution by equilibration with a sample. It is reported on a <2 mm base. High P retention indicates andic material.

p_citx.description: The phosphorus extractable by citric acid is an indicator of available phosphorus in the sample, reported as milligrams per kilogram on a <2 mm base.

p_bray2.description: This is the phosphorus extractable by the Bray-2  method, reported as milligrams per kilogram on a <2 mm base. Bray-2 extracts both adsorbed and easily acid-soluble forms of P.

p_bray1.description: This is the phosphorus extractable by the Bray-1 method, reported as milligrams per kilogram on a <2 mm base. It is used as an index of plant-available phosphorus. Bray-1 extracts adsorbed P.

p_h2o.description: The water soluble phosphorus is the fraction extracted by distilled water. It represents an attempt to approximate the P concentration in the soil solution, i.e. the mobile P.

ph_h2o.description: The pH, 1:1 soil-water suspension is the pH of a sample measured in distilled water at a 1:1 soil:solution ratio. If wider ratios increase the pH, salts are indicated.

pH_h2o.description: The pH, 1:1 soil-water suspension is the pH of a sample measured in distilled water at a 1:1 soil:solution ratio. If wider ratios increase the pH, salts are indicated.

ph_ox.description: The oxidized pH is the pH of a sample measured after incubation while saturated with distilled water. It is normally used to indicate the acid producing potential of acid sulfate materials.

pH_naf.description: The pH, 1:50 soil-NaF suspension is the pH of a sample measured in 1.0N NaF at a 1:50 soil:solution ratio. If PH_NAF is > 9.4, andic materials are indicated.

w3rec.description: 1/3 bar water, reconstituted moist is the gravimetric percent water in reconstituted samples (held moist) after equilibration at 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

db_recd.description: Bulk density, <2mm fraction, reconstituted, oven dry is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume measured on oven dry (105 C) reconstituted samples. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

db_rec3.description: Bulk density, <2mm fraction, reconstituted, 1/3 bar is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume measured on reconstituted samples at 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

db_10b.description: Bulk density, <2 mm fraction, 1/10 bar is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume being measured after equilibration at 1/10 bar water tension. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

w10cld.description: 1/10 bar water, clods is the gravimetric percent water retained at 1/10 bar tension. It is measured on natural fabric (clods), and reported on a <2 mm base.

w6clod.description: 0.06 bar water, <2mm fraction of clods is the gravimetric percent water held by clods equilibrated at 0.06 bar water tension. It is reported on a <2 mm base.

db_13b.description: Bulk density, <2 mm fraction, 1/3 bar is the weight per unit volume of the <2 mm fraction, with volume being measured after equilibration at 1/3 bar water tension. It is reported as grams per cubic centimeter on a <2 mm base.

abgll.description: Atterberg liquid limit is the gravimetric percent water content of the soil at a defined boundary between the liquid and plastic states. It is determined by ASTM method D 4318 and reported as percent water on a <0.4 mm base.

aggstb.description: Aggregate stability is the weight percent of 0.5mm - 2mm aggregates remaining after wet sieving.

db_13bw_basis.description: The basis for calculating the one-third bar bulk density on a whole soil basis is either the one-third bar bulk density (db_13b), the one-third bar rewet bulk density (db_3rw), the estimated one-third bar bulk density (db_3est), or a default value for one-third bulk density (1.45).

db_3est.description: Bulk density, 1/3 bar is estimated when no measured value exists. It has been estimated from rupture resistance, particle size distribution, and organic carbon.
